DataElement.preferredName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function BRIEF Parent Form Questionnaire Infrequency Scale Raw Score Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric representation of the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Parent Form - Infrequency Scale Raw Score.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function BRIEF Parent Form Questionnaire Infrequency Scale Score Raw Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale designed to assess the executive function behaviors in the school and home environments for children and adolescents as observed by a parent or teacher._A questionnaire included in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function. The parent form is completed by one or both parents who must have recent and extensive contact with the child over the past 6 months._Measures the extent to which the respondent endorsed items in an atypical fashion. This consists of three items where marking Sometimes or Often to any of the items is highly unusual, even for adolescents with severe cognitive impairment._A single score that is derived from a test or an observation and that has not been transformed or altered.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale designed to assess the executive function behaviors in the school and home environments for children and adolescents as observed by a parent or teacher.

Concepts.longName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function
Concepts.definition: A standardized rating scale designed to assess the executive function behaviors in the school and home environments for children and adolescents as observed by a parent or teacher.

Property.preferredName: BRIEF Parent Form Questionnaire Infrequency Scale Score Raw Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire included in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function. The parent form is completed by one or both parents who must have recent and extensive contact with the child over the past 6 months.:Measures the extent to which the respondent endorsed items in an atypical fashion. This consists of three items where marking Sometimes or Often to any of the items is highly unusual, even for adolescents with severe cognitive impairment. :A single score that is derived from a test or an observation and that has not been transformed or altered.

Concepts.definition: A questionnaire included in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function. The parent form is completed by one or both parents who must have recent and extensive contact with the child over the past 6 months.

Measures the extent to which the respondent endorsed items in an atypical fashion. This consists of three items where marking Sometimes or Often to any of the items is highly unusual, even for adolescents with severe cognitive impairment.
A single score that is derived from a test or an observation and that has not been transformed or altered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: BRIEF-Parent Version:Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Parent Version. Gerard A. Gioia, PhD, Peter K. Isquith, PhD, Steven C. Guy, PhD, and Lauren Kenworthy, PhD, Psychological Assessment Resources, Lutz, FL, 2000

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity that represents the conversion of an individual score into a standard form made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean for the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
